intro: Sphaeralcea orcuttii, commonly known as Orcutt's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact, bushy growth habit with hairy stems and leaves. Sphaeralcea orcuttii is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
